alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 5:21PM MST until August 21 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in central Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 518 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Dewey-Humboldt and Mayer. Between 1.25 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mayer, Spring Valley, Poland Junction, Cordes Junction, Cordes Lakes, and areas near Dewey-Humboldt. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 281. Interstate 17 between mile markers 261 and 266. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek, Agua Fria River, Big Bug Creek, Brushy Wash, Yarber Wash, Badger Spring Wash, Cedar Creek, Hackberry Creek, Sycamore Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
